newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia's Tapis crude trades at deep discount to APPI.
newsitem.headline: Asia's Tapis crude trades at deep discount to APPI.

text.p: Malaysia's light Tapis crude, Asia's benchmark grade, has traded at a discount to the weekly Asia Petroleum Price Index (APPI) quotes -- the first discounted trade in several years, traders said on Monday.
U.S. trader Phibro sold a 600,000-barrel cargo of August lifting Tapis crude to U.S. major Exxon at Tapis APPI -40 cents per barrel free-on-board.
APPI is Tapis standard pricing base.
It usually trades at a premium to APPI, but weak refinery margins and refinery maintenance shut downs, have combined to undermine the market.
Most recent Tapis deals have been done on a fixed price price basis because of uncertainty over the weakness of the market.
The last widely known Tapis deal on a floating price basis was for a July-lifting cargo at APPI +35 cents per barrel.
